thread.title: Police officer takes no chances - dons full riot gear to deal with deadly black widow spiders
thread.title_full: Police officer takes no chances - dons full riot gear to deal with deadly black widow spiders - Mirror Online

author: Jeff Parsons
title: Police officer takes no chances - dons full riot gear to deal with deadly black widow spiders
text:
There are some creatures you just don't take chances with. And it's fair to say a black widow spider is one of them.
So when you're faced with not just one, but several , what do you do?
Police officer Emily Carreno suited up in full riot gear. But she was still trembling as she removed the eight-legged intruders from a hallway.
The poisonous spiders were found inside police headquarters in the city of Golden, Colorado in the US.
The scariest call of the night at Golden PD. Officers located a suspicious party hanging out in the hallway. After...
Posted by Golden Police Department on Wednesday, 30 September 2015 According to the police force, the spiders in the hallway were exterminated but another was found in the locker room but escaped before it could be killed.
"The scariest call of the night at Golden PD," the department posted on its Facebook page .
"Officers located a suspicious party hanging out in the hallway. After further investigation, it was discovered that not just one, but several black widow spiders were invading the premises.
"For the safety of all of us, we are not posting pictures of the invaders."
You do not want to mess with one of these
Although no-one has died from a black widow bite since the early 20th century, the spiders carry enough venom to cause serious damage.
A bite can result in severe muscle pain, cramps, tachycardia and muscle spasms. Symptoms can last anywhere from three days to several weeks.
Last month, one terrified arachnophobe found a black widow spider crawling about in a punnet of newly-bought grapes .
